name: Bandwidth SDKs and Sample Applications
tagline: Tools and libraries to jump start your communications!
body:
![Bandwidth](https://s3.amazonaws.com/bandwidth-public-assets/logo3d3.jpg)
## Requirements
First, signup for [Bandwidth's App Platform](http://ap.bandwidth.com/utm_medium=social&utm_source=github&utm_campaign=dtolb&utm_content=)

## SDKs
Language | SDK Location | SDK Examples
-------- | ------------ | ------------
NodeJS | [Github](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/node-bandwidth) | [Examples](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/node-bandwidth-example)
Python | [Github](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/python-bandwidth) | [Examples](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/python-bandwidth-examples)
Ruby | [Github](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/ruby-bandwidth) | [Examples](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/ruby-bandwidth-example)
C# | [Github](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/csharp-bandwidth) | [Examples](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/csharp-bandwidth-examples)
Java | [Github](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/java-bandwidth) | [Examples](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/java-bandwidth-examples)
PHP | [Github](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/php-bandwidth) | [Examples](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/php-bandwidth-examples)

## Sample Apps
***
Here are some sample apps made with [Bandwidth's App Platform](ap.bandwidth.com/utm_medium=social&utm_source=github&utm_campaign=dtolb&utm_content=)

### NodeJS
***
#### [Voice Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-voice-reference-app)
This application demonstrates how to implement voice calling for mobile devices, browsers (WebRTC), and any SIP client using the Bandwidth Application Platform.

#### [Bandcast](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/Bandcast)
A full functioning web application to help manage communications for hackathons and conferences

#### [Bandwidth 2-Factor Auth Server](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/bw2fa-server)
bw2fa-server is a standalone two factor auth service that only requires Bandwidth App Platform credentials to start! The server requires very little configuration. Start by cloning our github repository.

#### [Bandwidth 2-Factor Auth Client](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/bw2fa-client-nodejs)
NodeJS client implementation for the [Bandwidth 2-Factor Auth Server](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/bw2fa-server)

#### [Early Media](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-earlymedia-example)
Sample application demoing early media detection with Bandwidth

#### [Call Tracking API with BXML](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-call-tracking-bxml-express)
Sample application to demo a call tracking API functionality with Node and BXML

#### [Call Tracking BXML](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-call-tracking)
Basic call tracking application. Really only displays a UI.

#### [Assisted Transfer](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-assisted-transfer)
This example shows how to implement an assisted transfer flow using the node SDK

#### [Messaging Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-messaging-reference-app)
Basic Messaging application for Bandwidth.

#### [Click-to-Call](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/node-click-to-call)
Simple application which allows to make calls directly to sip account, redirect outgoing calls from sip account to another number, redirect incoming calls from specific number to sip account.

### Python
***
#### [Voice Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/python-voice-reference-app)
This application demonstrates how to implement voice calling for mobile devices, browsers (WebRTC), and any SIP client using the Bandwidth Application Platform.

### Ruby
***
#### [Voice Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/ruby-voice-reference-app)
This application demonstrates how to implement voice calling for mobile devices, browsers (WebRTC), and any SIP client using the Bandwidth Application Platform.

#### [Assisted Transfer](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/ruby-assisted-transfer)
This example shows how to implement an assisted transfer flow using the ruby SDK

#### [Call Tracking](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/ruby-call-tracking)
Sample App for Call Tracking (UI Only)

#### [Click-to-Call](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/ruby-click-to-call)
 Simple application which allows to make calls directly to sip account, redirect outgoing calls from sip account to another number, redirect incoming calls from specific number to sip account.

#### [Masked 2-way SMS](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/ruby-masked-2-way-sms)
Example app to add a second phone number to your wireless phone.

### CSharp
***
#### [Voice Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-voice-reference-app)
This application demonstrates how to implement voice calling for mobile devices, browsers (WebRTC), and any SIP client using the Bandwidth Application Platform.

#### [Assisted Transfer](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-assisted-transfer)
This example shows how to implement an assisted transfer flow using the C# SDK

#### [Call Tracking](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-call-tracking)
Sample App for Call Tracking (UI Only)

#### [Click-to-Call](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-click-to-call)
 Simple application which allows to make calls directly to sip account, redirect outgoing calls from sip account to another number, redirect incoming calls from specific number to sip account.

#### [Call Contacts](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-call-contacts-example)
Examples shows how to create outbound calls from a list of contacts.

#### [Voice Mail with BXML](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-bxml-voicemail)
Example of generating dynamic BXML for a voicemail app.

#### [Messaging Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/csharp-messaging-reference-app)
Basic Messaging application for Bandwidth.

### Java
***
#### [Voice Reference](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/java-reference-app-voice)
This application demonstrates how to implement voice calling for mobile devices, browsers (WebRTC), and any SIP client using the Bandwidth Application Platform.

#### [Conference with BXML](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/java-conference-with-bxml)
Example shows how to to use Java and BXML to implement a simple conference app. It uses Java servlets and JSP for a MVC2 approach without a third party MVC framework.

#### [Call Tracking](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/java-call-tracking)
Sample App for Call Tracking (UI Only)

#### [SMS Delivery Receipt](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/java-bandwidth-sms-dlr-example)
Simple Servlet for handling SMS and Delivery Receipt event using the [Bandwidth Java SDK](https://github.com/bandwidthcom/java-bandwidth)

#### [Appointment Reminder](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/java-appointment-reminders)
An Appointment Reminder Application example from Bandwidth.

### PHP
***
#### [Voice Reference](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/php-voice-reference-app)
This application demonstrates how to implement voice calling for mobile devices, browsers (WebRTC), and any SIP client using the Bandwidth Application Platform.

#### [Appointment Reminder](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/php-voice-appt-reminder)
An Appointment Reminder Application example from Bandwidth.

#### [Call Forwarding](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/php-call-forwarding)
Basic start PHP app for doing call forwarding

#### [Auto Reply](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/php-auto-reply)
Simple starter app for doing an auto-reply to an inbound SMS message

#### [Assisted Transfer with BXML](https://github.com/BandwidthExamples/php-assisted-transfer-with-BXML)
This project is provided as an example on how to how to implement a simple assisted transfer flow using Bandwidth XML (BXML).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
